sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
snaps
, se nenadoma pretrga ali prelomi, največkrat z rezkim pokom.

seg.quote: One of those kicks could snap you in half like a dry twig.
The snap of a twig broke the silence.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
snaps into position
, se hitro in z ostrim pokom postavi v določen položaj.

seg.quote: The jaws snapped shut around her arm.
She snapped the silver chain around her neck.
The trap closes with a sudden snap.

sense.def:
To snap one's fingers
pomeni povzročiti oster zvok tako, da sredinec naglo potegnemo prek kazalca.

Kadar žival
snaps at someone
, hitro zapre čeljusti zelo blizu nekoga.

seg.quote: The dogs ran snapping and barking at his heels.

sense.def:
To snap at someone
pomeni nekaj reči nekomu z ostrim, neprijaznim glasom.

Odločitev ali dejanje, ki je
snap
, sprejmemo ali izvedemo nenadoma, ne da bi prej natančno premislili.

seg.quote: The snap reaction of the press was to welcome the change.

sense.def:
A snap
je fotografija, ki je posneta hitro in brez priprav;

To snap something up
pomeni nekaj hitro kupiti;

seg.quote: All these houses were snapped up as soon as they were offered for sale.
